intro: Senecillis arnicoides, commonly known as the False Arnica, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant features hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used traditionally for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
